intro: Comandra umbellata var. pallida, commonly known as the pale comandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments.
